title: Team Up
description: Combine data from multiple tables using INNER JOIN to find relationships between citizens and their jobs.
story: The city database is split into multiple tables. You need to connect citizens with their employment records to find who works where.
hint: Use INNER JOIN to combine the citizens table with the jobs table. Match them using the citizen_id field.
tableSetup: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS jobs CASCADE;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS citizens CASCADE;
CREATE TABLE citizens (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100), age INT, district VARCHAR(50));
CREATE TABLE jobs (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, citizen_id INT, company VARCHAR(100), position VARCHAR(100), salary INT);
INSERT INTO citizens (name, age, district) VALUES ('Alice Johnson', 28, 'Downtown'), ('Bob Smith', 35, 'Uptown'), ('Charlie Brown', 42, 'Midtown');
